sentences: Brazillia R. Kreep  (a.k.a.
section: N/A

sentences: The Kreep) is a Gothic poet, playwright, composer, lyricist, and illustrator in the tradition of Edward Gorey, and is the nom de plume of writer R. O’Donnell.

== Premise and background ==

sentences: Premise and background ==
section: == Premise and background ==
== Premise and background == | === Static Multimedia ===

sentences: Static Multimedia =
section: == Premise and background == | === Static Multimedia ===
== Premise and background == | === Static Multimedia ===

sentences: The Kreep first appeared on Halloween, 2007 as a weekly column published by webzine Static Multimedia.
section: == Premise and background == | === Static Multimedia ===

sentences: The column, under the banner of Kreep's Korner, reviewed classic and contemporary horror films in rhyme which were also linked to a weekly podcast on iTunes, voiced by creator O'Donnell and engineered by Eric Hoffhines.
section: == Premise and background == | === Static Multimedia ===

sentences: Formatted to resemble a penned letter to its readers, Kreep's Korner included historical facts and an original poem about the film with the reoccurring sign-off of "In Eternity".
section: == Premise and background == | === Static Multimedia ===
== Premise and background == | === Blogging and poetry ===

sentences: Blogging and poetry
section: == Premise and background == | === Blogging and poetry ===
== Premise and background == | === Blogging and poetry ===

sentences: In 2008, O'Donnell began blogging regularly under "The Kreep" banner.
section: == Premise and background == | === Blogging and poetry ===

sentences: Gothic poems in verse dubbed "Kreeplets" appeared almost daily, illustrated with original art, and covered a variety of macabre topics such as vampires, ghouls, and goblins.
section: == Premise and background == | === Blogging and poetry ===

sentences: Other topics outside the sphere of horror included homelessness, love, war, and poverty.
section: == Premise and background == | === Blogging and poetry ===

sentences: Additional blogs began reposting The Kreep such as In Shadows, Dirty Wings, and Gothican on a regular basis.
section: == Premise and background == | === Blogging and poetry ===

sentences: Also in 2008, The Kreep was featured on the NeverEndingWonder Halloween Radio's Voices of Halloween - a series of Halloween memories, greetings and station IDs by some of the most infamous names in the horror business.
section: == Premise and background == | === Blogging and poetry ===

sentences: Along with Forrest J. Ackerman (editor Famous Monsters of Filmland magazine), Vic Mizzy (composer The Addams Family, The Night Walker), and David Hedison (1958, actor, The Fly), The Kreep offered anecdotes about his meetings with Vincent Price and how Freddy Krueger actor Robert Englund celebrated Halloween.
section: == Premise and background == | === Blogging and poetry ===

sentences: Kreepmas and Jack Frost Day
section: == Premise and background == | === Kreepmas and Jack Frost Day ===
== Premise and background == | === Kreepmas and Jack Frost Day ===

sentences: The Kreep also celebrates several faux holidays such as Kreepmas and Jack Frost Day, which are celebrated yearly in poems and original art.
section: == Premise and background == | === Kreepmas and Jack Frost Day ===

sentences: Kreepmas combines Halloween and Christmas, and is celebrated October 1 through December 31.
section: == Premise and background == | === Kreepmas and Jack Frost Day ===

sentences: Jack Frost Day is celebrated through the month of December and was originally conceived as a way for O'Donnell, due to a separation, to celebrate the holidays with his three children.
section: == Premise and background == | === Kreepmas and Jack Frost Day ===
